greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of parts of even multiplicities in all the partitions of n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: g := (sum(x^(2*j)/(1+x^j), j = 1 .. 100))/(product(1-x^j, j = 1 .. 100)): gser := series(g, x = 0, 70): seq(coeff(gser, x, n), n = 0 .. 60);
mathematica: Needs["Combinatorica`"]; Table[Count[Last /@ Flatten[Tally /@ Combinatorica`Partitions@ n, 1], k_ /; EvenQ@ k], {n, 0, 50}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 21 2015 *)
program: (PARI) { my(n=50); Vec(sum(k=1, n, x^(2*k)/(1+x^k) + O(x*x^n)) / prod(k=1, n, 1-x^k + O(x*x^n)), -(n+1)) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 22 2017
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 21 2015
